title: Why Premium Hardwood Mulch Matters for Your Soil Health
intro: Premium hardwood mulch does more than make your landscape look clean — it improves soil health, protects plant roots, and helps regulate moisture throughout Chicago’s extreme seasons.
content:
Mulch as a Soil Protector

Mulch shields soil from direct sun, preventing evaporation and helping plants retain the moisture they need. It also insulates roots during winter, protecting them from harsh Chicago freezes.

Why Hardwood Mulch Is Superior

Premium hardwood mulch breaks down slowly, enriching the soil with organic matter. Cheap dyed mulches often contain construction debris or chemicals that do more harm than good.

Health Benefits for Plants

• Prevents weed growth
• Reduces soil compaction
• Regulates soil temperature
• Improves microbial activity

Conclusion

Professional mulch installation enhances curb appeal and improves long-term plant health.
